That’s why I’m talking to you. Honestly, it’s a good thing you only killed the old woman. If you’d gone with another theory, you could’ve done something way worse. You might want to thank God for that. Who knows? Maybe God has a plan for you. But keep your chin up and don’t be scared! Are you worried about facing the consequences? You shouldn’t be. After making such a choice, you need to toughen up. There’s a sense of justice in this. I know you might not believe it, but life will help you get through this. You’ll move on in time. What you really need now is fresh air—lots of it!

Raskolnikov jumped a bit. 

“Who are you? What kind of prophet are you? From where do you get this wisdom?” 

“Who am I? Just a guy with nothing to look forward to, that’s all. I might have some feelings and knowledge, but my time has passed. You, on the other hand, have a whole life ahead of you. But who knows? Your life might also fade away into nothing. So what if you move into a different crowd? Is it comfort you’re missing? It’s not about time; it’s about you deciding your path. Be like the sun, and everyone will notice you. The sun just needs to be the sun. Why are you smiling? Thinking I’m trying to flatter you? Maybe I am, he-he-he!

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is urged to confront his actions and embrace the possibility of redemption despite his fears and despair.
